Financial Performance:

Macrotech Developers reported a 38.5% rise in Q4 profit to ₹921.7 crore.

The company also declared a dividend of ₹4.25 per share.

For the entire financial year 2024-25, the consolidated net profit increased by 71% to ₹2,764 crore, with topline growing by 34% to ₹13,780 crore.

Expansion & Investment:

Macrotech Developers planned to invest ₹8,000 crore in the fiscal year 2025-26, primarily for land acquisition in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR), Pune, and Bengaluru.

This investment aimed to generate ₹25,000 crore in revenue from new housing projects.

The company also planned to launch 17 housing projects covering 13 million square feet with an estimated sales booking potential of ₹19,000 crore in FY26.

Strategic Shift:

Macrotech Developers announced a strategic shift to balance growth and income for stability.

The company allotted 1.74 lakh equity shares under ESOS (Employee Stock Option Scheme).

Lodha Developers remained a focus in the real estate sector, with comparisons drawn to other players like Godrej Properties, noting Lodha's focus on premium projects and margins.
